title: Buhari campaign gets its numbers wrong about ‘record’ Nigeria agricultural exports
subtitle: In a TV debate, the president’s spokesman claimed the country raked in N577 billion in the first quarter of 2018, but official data doesn’t back him up.
author: africacheck.org

Conclusion: Nigeria earned N73bn, not N577bn, from agricultural goods in Q1 2018

Boosting agriculture to create jobs is a key policy for Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari in the run-up to the 2019 elections. Festus Keyamo, the media director of his re-election campaign, claimed that the country earned N577 billion from agricultural exports from January to March 2018.

But agricultural products only brought in N73.24 billion in this period, official data shows. Keyamo’s figure is the same as the N577.6 billion earned by

non-oil exports in the first quarter.

We therefore rate his claim as incorrect.
